column4: anyone know how to get programs to appear in your applications menu after they are installed via terminal?
only if they have a "definition" file for the gnome menu
then they should appear right away, or do "sudo kill gnome-panel" (but some taskbar icons may dissappear)
i installed this program before on a previous ubuntu installation and it appeared in the apps menu but now it wont
but nothing i download and install appears in the menus..
yes,,, i tried relogging in and restarting the computer as well
thanks for your help.  but i dont think thats whats wrong since this happens with every program i install
but, hoary did find my HP pcs1200 automaticly, breezy didnt :)
hmm, did you allso try the applications - add application ?
its wierd.. i installed ubuntu two weeks ago.. it recognized my ext hd.. and installed some progs on the menu.. now this new installation.. does neither
no i havent.. im not familiar with using that
its like synaptic, and it should 100% add menu entries whe prog installed
k im looking at it now.. its mostly KDE apps.. and my progs i want are not listed...
in "worst-case" you could add the programs manually to the menu
how do you add them manually?
right click in the menu (applications) in the panel
